puzzleBody: What building has the most stories?
What two things can you never eat for breakfast?
How many apples grow on a tree?
puzzleSolution: All apples grow on trees only.

puzzleBody: A car driver is going opposite traffic on a one-way street. A police officer sees him but doesn't stop him.Why didn't the police officer stop him?
Which comes first, chicken or egg?
puzzleSolution: Chicken. Ever heard of a dictionary? Alphabetic order!!!

puzzleBody:
On Wednesday, a thief enters a shop and threatens the clerk, forcing him to open the safe. The clerk says, "The code for the safe is different every day, and if you hurt me you'll never get the code". But the thief manages to guess the code on his own.
 How did he do it?
puzzleSolution:
There are two solutions people often argue with this.
 1. The code is "different." The clerk told him this.
 2.Wednesday-everyday different mean day name only changes so he entered on Wednesday so he thinks day name is code.

puzzleBody:
Mary's mother has three children. The first was named April. The next was named May.
 What is the final one's name?
You are my brother, but I am not your brother. Who am I?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
How many seconds are in a year?
How do you make the number "one" disappear by adding to it?
Scientists are trying to figure out what is between Heaven and Earth.What is it?
What was the president of the United State's name in 1980?
puzzleSolution: The answer for this riddle is the current president name only. As his name is same as in 1980 also

What's the first thing you do when you see her?
